intro: Clidemia holosericea, commonly known as the velvetleaf or white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces showy, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests and disturbed areas. Clidemia holosericea is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it an invasive species in some regions.
